Peter and Steve, the way I would approach this problem is to start 
with th=
e simplest possible model and get it working before moving to 
more complex=
 or biologically plausible ones.  It's interesting to 
note that Tyler Stre=
eter evolved his biped with no inputs!  He was 
trying to see if a fully re=
current network on its own with no inputs 
could produce a temporal walking=
 pattern.  Of course that makes the 
problem quite difficult, and giving so=
me feedback (i.e. inputs) makes 
the problem easier.  However, too many inp=
uts could tip the 
difficulty back in the other direction.  In any case, my=
 approach to 
a hard problem is always to first see if I can do the easiest=
 version 
of it.

By the way, about Natural Motion, most of their current s=
tuff 
probably is mainly hand-coded.  They started out using CTRNNs but 
th=
ey moved on the scripting and other things as Peter mentioned.  So 
they ar=
e a very difficult target to match with evolution alone.

By the way, thank=
s for the encouraging words on NEAT and HyperNEAT.

ken

els touching.
